page.title: 03AMBULANCE STN ROUGE BOUILLON
page.content: {The Jersey Ambulance Station}was set up in{Rouge Bouillon} in 1981.It is part of the {States of Jersey Health {Service.}From its control room it controls the ambulance service for the whole of the island. This consists of seven large ambulances, 5 mini-ambulances, 1 sitting car for wheel chair patients and one automatic ambulance.The ambulances are linked by intercom and the ambulance station has its own generator so that it can keep going in a power cut. One ambulance has a four-wheel drive for beach cases. There are 33 on the staff and each ambulance has two men in it when it goes on an emergency.The ambulance men are often concerned with cliff rescues. Quite often in the daytime many of the ambulances are on the road for most of the time.
